result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J. Spinelli was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
--serve 45 days in Jail, to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System; to commence forthwith concurrent to each other and to any other sentence.  The Court imposes the sentences with the understanding that the Defendant remains eligible for prison programing. The Court indicates that if the Court's sentences undermines Mr. Spinelli's prison programming, then the DOC should inform the Court of this.
Concurrent with: Count 2 of 22CF84 and to any other sentence
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge within 90 days. Non-payment will result in the entry of  a civil judgment for the amount due.

defendant.name: Spinelli, Andrew J.
defendant.address: N4237 Alpine Village Lane, Cambridge, WI 53523

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 11:10am 
Defendant Andrew J. Spinelli in court, in custody, with Attorney Amber Rumpf.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Counts #1 and #2; factual basis stipulated.  The Court accepts the pleas, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #3, #4, and #5.

On Count #1 and Count #2 each the Court sentences Mr. Spinelli to:
--serve 45 days in Jail, to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System; to commence forthwith concurrent to each other and to any other sentence.  The Court imposes the sentences with the understanding that the Defendant remains eligible for prison programing. The Court indicates that if the Court's sentences undermines Mr. Spinelli's prison programming, then the DOC should inform the Court of this.
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge within 90 days. Non-payment will result in the entry of  a civil judgment for the amount due. 
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings are given. 
recess  11:33am
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (08/09) ML
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Prior: 411 S Center Ave, c/o Jefferson Co Jail, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States

Atty Rumpf indicates that Mr. Spinelli is in acceptance of State's most recent offer; requests a video plea & sentencing be scheduled.

Scheduling is discussed. 
recess: 8:55am

[ma] Case called at 1:34 PM 
Defendant Andrew J. Spinelli appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies address, indicates that date of birth is: 6/8/1976

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $1000  Signature Bond, no special conditions.

An amended complaint will be filed to correct Defendant's date of birth.

The Court finds probable cause on the four corners of the complaint.
recess 1:39  pm.
